prepencounterdetails:
• Difficulty: Medium
  • Overall CR: 2
  • Veteran (1) – CR 3, Guard (2) – CR 1/8
  • Tactics: Guards hold the gate; veteran steps forward to parley. If combat starts, veteran focuses on the strongest-looking PC.
prepsetup: • Key Moment: The veteran offers a chance to explain yourselves before blades are drawn.
contextintro: The party reaches a manned gatehouse, then may pass into the mine proper.

sections.sectionintro: Use this section when the party first arrives. The veteran will parley; the party can talk or fight.

cards.carddescriptionprimary: The veteran steps forward, hand resting on his sword hilt but not drawing. His gaze sweeps the party. "State your business. The mines are closed to strangers." The two guards behind him keep their spears ready but do not advance. There is still a chance to talk your way through.
cards.carddescriptionsecondary: A successful appeal to reason, bribery, or authority may see the party waved through without bloodshed. Failure may force the other path.
cards.carddialogue: Veteran \"State your business. The mines are closed to strangers.\"

cards.carddescriptionprimary: Steel rings as weapons are drawn. The veteran barks an order and the guards form a loose line. The gatehouse becomes a killing ground—stone walls limit movement, and the guards know the ground. There is no turning back now.
cards.carddescriptionsecondary: Victory here may secure passage but will leave the mine's masters aware that intruders have come. The bodies will be found.

sections.sectionintro: Use this section once the party has passed the gate (by parley or combat). They see the mine entrance proper.

cards.carddescriptionprimary: Beyond the gatehouse, a broad tunnel slopes down into the earth. Torch sconces line the walls, and the air carries the smell of worked stone and old smoke. Distant sounds of picks and carts echo from below. The path splits ahead: one branch descends toward the noise, the other runs level and darker.
cards.carddescriptionsecondary: The party can follow the activity or explore the quieter passage.

contextadditionalnarration:
• Gatehouse has one main door and a side passage to the barracks.
  • If the party fled earlier encounters, the guards may be more alert.
contextatmosphere:
• Sight: Torchlight, stone arch, armed figures.
  • Sound: Boots on stone, distant mine echoes.
  • Smell: Smoke, sweat, damp stone.
  • Touch: Cool, drafty air.
  • Geometry: Single room, about 20 ft square; gate behind the guards.
contextgmnotes:
• Difficulty: Medium.
  • Tactics: Veteran uses multiattack; guards try to flank. Consider surrender if the veteran drops.
  • Roleplay: Veteran is loyal but not fanatical; he can be reasoned with if the party has a convincing story or papers.
  • Consequences: Combat here may raise alarms deeper in the mine.
